title: National College of Art and Design Logo, Typeface Please...
content:
Hi everyone, I was hoping someone would be able to identify this typeface used in the Irish National College of Art and Design for their logo, It was designed a number of years ago and no tutor seems to know the original typeface as it was done in metal.

Thanks for your help! Rob

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ncad-logo02.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906164713/http:/typophile.com/files/ncad-logo02.jpg) | 85.87 KB |

 [‹ Low Slung Geometric](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906164713/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43039 "Go to previous forum topic") [From Polish constructivist manifesto 1923 ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906164713/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43075 "Go to next forum topic")
author: robbiefa

comments.content:
Hi Rob,

reminds me of [Meridien](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906164713/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/meridien/familytree.html).  
F
Thanks Florian, as always your the man! I think thats fairly spot on!
